intro: Pleurospermum pulszkyi, commonly known as the Hungarian tansy, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, elongated fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Pleurospermum pulszkyi is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used historically in traditional herbal medicine.
